rapt.英释: so interested in something that you do not notice anything else

pert.中释: 无礼的, 爱管闲事的, 鲁莽的, 辛辣的, 活跃的, 别致的

cult.英释: a group of people who are very interested in a particular thing

beam.中释: 梁, 桁条, (光线的)束, 柱, 电波, 横梁
beam.英释: a long heavy piece of wood or metal used in building houses, bridges etc

rift.中释: 裂缝, 裂口, 断裂, 长狭谷, 不和
rift.英释: a crack or narrow opening in a large mass of rock, cloud etc

bulb.英释: a root shaped like a ball that grows into a flower or plant

ream.英释: a large amount of writing on paper

bore.中释: 令人讨厌的人, 怒潮, 枪膛, 孔
bore.英释: something that is not interesting to you or that annoys you

lien.中释: 留置权, 抵押品所产生的利息
lien.英释: the legal right to keep something that belongs to someone who owes you money, until the debt has been paid

curb.英释: the raised edge of a road, between where people can walk and cars can drive

axle.英释: the bar connecting two wheels on a car or other vehicle

pier.英释: a structure that is built over and into the water so that boats can stop next to it or people can walk along it

fuss.中释: 忙乱, 大惊小怪, 大惊小怪的人
fuss.英释: anxious behaviour or activity that is usually about unimportant things

soot.英释: black powder that is produced when something is burned

ogle.中释: 媚眼, 送秋波, 眉目传情

bolt.中释: 门闩, 螺钉, 闪电, 跑掉
bolt.英释: a screw with a flat head and no point, for fastening things together

mask.中释: 面具, 掩饰, 石膏面像
mask.英释: something that covers all or part of your face, to protect or to hide it

fiat.中释: 命令, 法令, 许可, 批准
fiat.英释: an official order given by someone in a position of authority, without considering what other people want

mare.中释: 母马, 母驴, 月球或火星等表面阴暗区

list.中释: 目录, 名单, 列表, 序列, 数据清单, 明细表, 条纹, [总称]各种上市证券
list.英释: a set of names, numbers etc, usually written one below the other, for example so that you can remember or check them

teat.英释: the rubber part on a baby’s bottle that the baby sucks milk from

twig.中释: 嫩枝, 小枝, 末梢
twig.英释: a small very thin stem of wood that grows from a branch on a tree

byre.英释: a farm building in which cattle are kept

boor.中释: 农民, 粗野的人, 不懂礼貌的人, (Boor)波尔人
boor.英释: a man who behaves in a very rude way

puke.中释: 呕吐, 呕吐物, 吐剂
puke.英释: food brought back up from your stomach through your mouth

idol.中释: 偶像, 崇拜物, 幻象, [逻]谬论
idol.英释: someone or something that you love or admire very much

coup.中释: 砰然而有效的一击, 妙计, 出乎意料的行动, 政变
coup.英释: a sudden and sometimes violent attempt by citizens or the army to take control of the government

fink.中释: 破坏及反罢工的人, 告发人, 密告人, 乞丐
fink.英释: someone who tells the police, a teacher, or a parent when someone else breaks a rule or a law

flag.英释: a piece of cloth with a coloured pattern or picture on it that represents a country or organization

pelf.英释: money or wealth, esp if dishonestly acquired; lucre

ford.英释: a place where a river is not deep, so that you can walk or drive across it

beat.中释: 敲打, 拍子, 巡逻区域
beat.英释: one of the notes in a piece of music that sounds stronger than the other notes

crag.英释: a high and very steep rough rock or mass of rocks

funk.中释: 怯懦, 恐惧, 臭味, 恐怖

lean.中释: 倾斜, 倾斜度, 倚靠, 倾向
lean.英释: the condition of inclining from a vertical position

maze.中释: 曲径, 迷宫, 迷津, 迷惘, 迷惑, 糊涂
maze.英释: a specially designed system of paths, often in a park or public garden, which is difficult to find your way through

lava.英释: hot liquid rock that flows from a volcano,or this rock when it has become solid

milk.英释: a white liquid produced by cows or goats that is drunk by people

yarn.中释: 纱, 纱线, 故事, 奇谈
yarn.英释: thick thread made of cotton or wool, which is used to knit things

peak.中释: 山顶, 顶点, 帽舌, (记录的)最高峰
peak.英释: the time when something or someone is best, greatest, highest, most successful etc

moan.中释: 呻吟, 哀悼, 呼啸
moan.英释: a long low sound expressing pain, unhappiness, or sexual pleasure

myth.中释: 神话, 神话式的人物(或事物), 虚构的故事, 荒诞的说法
myth.英释: an idea or story that many people believe, but which is not true

tyro.中释: 生手, 初学者, 新手

alms.中释: 施舍, 救济物(钱,食物,衣物等)
alms.英释: money, food etc given to poor people in the past

snob.英释: someone who thinks they are better than people from a lower social class – used to show disapproval

lace.中释: 饰带, 花边, 缎带, 鞋带
lace.英释: a string that is pulled through special holes in shoes or clothing to pull the edges together and fasten them

oath.中释: 誓言, 宣誓, 诅咒
oath.英释: a formal and very serious promise

hide.英释: an animal’s skin, especially when it has been removed to be used for leather

herd.英释: a group of animals of one kind that live and feed together

bark.英释: the sharp loud sound made by a dog

grig.中释: 爽朗的人, 轻松愉快的人

rote.中释: 死记硬背, 机械的做法, 生搬硬套
rote.英释: when you learn something by repeating it many times, without thinking about it carefully or without understanding it

pine.英释: a tall tree with long hard sharp leaves that do not fall off in winter

hoof.英释: the hard foot of an animal such as a horse, cow etc

beet.英释: a vegetable that sugar is made from

halt.中释: 停止, 暂停, 中断

vent.中释: 通风孔, 出烟孔, 出口, (感情等的)发泄
vent.英释: a hole or pipe through which gases, liquid etc can enter or escape from an enclosed space or container

mort.中释: 通知猎物已死的号角声, 大量, 许多
mort.英释: a call blown on a hunting horn to signify the death of the animal hunted

peer.英释: your peers are the people who are the same age as you, or who have the same type of job, social class etc

swig.中释: 痛饮, 大喝(尤指从瓶口喝的)

hood.中释: 头巾, 兜帽, 车蓬, 引擎罩
hood.英释: the metal covering over the engine on a car

pelt.中释: 投掷, 疾行, 毛皮
pelt.英释: the fur or hair of a living animal

icon.中释: 图标, 肖像, 偶像
icon.英释: a small sign or picture on a computer screen that is used to start a particular operation

soil.中释: 土壤, 土地, 国土, 国家, 温床, 粪便, 务农
soil.英释: the top layer of the earth in which plants grow

hump.中释: 驼峰, 驼背, 小园丘, 峰丘
hump.英释: a raised part on the back of a  camel

rind.英释: the thick outer skin of some types of fruit, such as oranges

warp.中释: 弯曲, 歪曲, 乖僻, 偏差, 乖戾, 偏见
warp.英释: a part of something that has become bent or twisted from its original shape

mite.中释: 微小的东西, <口>小孩, 力所能及的微小贡献
mite.英释: a small child, especially one that you feel sorry for

mast.中释: 桅, 桅杆, 柱, 旗杆, 天线竿
mast.英释: a tall pole on which the sails or flags on a ship are hung

cant.中释: 伪善之言, 黑话, 隐语, 斜面, 角落
cant.英释: insincere talk about moral or religious principles by someone who is pretending to be better than they really are

file.中释: 文件, 档案, 文件夹, 卷宗, 锉刀
file.英释: a set of papers, records etc that contain information about a particular person or subject

writ.中释: 文书, 正式文件, 书面命令
writ.英释: a document from a court that orders someone to do or not to do something

lair.英释: the place where a wild animal hides and sleeps

wold.中释: 无树木的山地, 荒野

iota.中释: 希腊语字母第 9位, 极微小

raid.英释: a short attack on a place by soldiers, planes, or ships, intended to cause damage but not take control

beau.中释: 喜修饰者, 纨绔子弟, 情郎, 求爱者
beau.英释: A woman's beau is her boyfriend or lover

chit.中释: 小孩, (活泼的)少女, 芽
chit.英释: a pert, impudent, or self-confident girl or child

gnat.英释: A gnat is a very small flying insect that bites people and usually lives near water

colt.中释: 小马, 无经验的年轻人

veal.中释: 小牛肉, 幼小的菜牛
veal.英释: the meat of a calf(= a young cow )

coop.中释: 小屋, 鸡(兔)笼, 拘留所, <俗>监狱
coop.英释: a building for small animals, especially chickens

jest.英释: something you say that is intended to be funny, not serious

mime.英释: the use of movements to express what you want to say without using words, or a play where the actors use only movements

vamp.英释: a woman who uses her sexual attractiveness to make men do what she wants

toil.中释: 辛苦, 苦工, 网, 罗网, 圈套
toil.英释: hard unpleasant work done over a long period

jerk.中释: 性情古怪的人, 急推, 猛拉, 肌肉抽搐, (生理)反射, 牛肉干

cuff.中释: 袖口, 裤子翻边, 护腕, 手铐

eddy.英释: a circular movement of water, wind, dust etc

lore.中释: 学问，知识，（动物的）眼光知识
lore.英释: knowledge or information about a subject, for example nature or magic, that is not written down but is passed from person to person

gore.中释: 血块, 淤血, (帆或裙上缝的)三角形布
gore.英释: a tapering or triangular piece of material used in making a shaped skirt, umbrella, etc

mute.中释: 哑巴, 哑音字母, [律]拒不答辩的被告, 弱音器
mute.英释: a small piece of metal, rubber etc that you place over or into a musical instrument to make it sound softer

flax.中释: 亚麻, 麻布, 亚麻织品, 亚麻制的
flax.英释: a plant with blue flowers, used for making cloth and oil

honk.英释: a loud noise made by a  goose

gist.中释: 要点, 要旨, 依据, [法律]诉讼主因
gist.英释: the main idea and meaning of what someone has said or written

prig.英释: someone who behaves in a morally good way and shows that they disapprove of the way other people behave - used to show disapproval

bout.中释: 一回, 一场, 回合, 较量
bout.英释: a short period of time during which you do something a lot, especially something that is bad for you

tiff.中释: 一口淡酒, 小争吵, 小口角, 酒
tiff.英释: a slight argument between friends or people who are in love

bevy.中释: 一群鸟, 一群(少女或少妇), <俗>一堆东西, 一群人
bevy.英释: a large group of people of the same kind, especially girls or young women

whim.中释: 一时的兴致, 幻想, 反复无常, 怪念头, 奇想
whim.英释: a sudden feeling that you would like to do or have something, especially when there is no important or good reason

loaf.中释: 一条面包, 块, 游荡
loaf.英释: bread that is shaped and baked in one piece and can be cut into slices

rite.中释: 仪式, 典礼, 习俗, 惯例, 礼拜式, 教派
rite.英释: a ceremony that is always performed in the same way, usually for religious purposes

dupe.中释: 易受骗的人, 易受愚弄的人
dupe.英释: A dupe is someone who is tricked by someone else

leer.中释: 淫荡的目光, 恶意的目光

nook.英释: a small quiet place which is sheltered by a rock, a big tree etc

hawk.中释: 鹰, 掠夺他人的人, 鹰派成员
hawk.英释: a large bird that hunts and eats small birds and animals

aeon.英释: an extremely long period of time

pest.英释: a small animal or insect that destroys crops or food supplies

silt.中释: 淤泥, 残渣, 煤粉, 泥沙
silt.英释: sand, mud, soil etc that is carried in water and then settles at a bend in a river, an entrance to a port etc

barb.中释: 鱼钩, 鱼叉的倒钩, 巴巴里鸽(一种类似信鸽的鸽子)
barb.英释: the sharp curved point of a hook,  arrow  etc that prevents it from being easily pulled out

omen.英释: a sign of what will happen in the future

dome.英释: a round roof on a building

lobe.中释: 圆形突出部（尤指耳垂）, [植]圆裂片
lobe.英释: the soft piece of flesh at the bottom of your ear

lark.中释: 云雀, 百灵鸟, 灰黄色, 诗人, 嬉戏, 玩乐
lark.英释: a small brown singing bird with long pointed wings

laud.中释: 赞美, 称赞, 颂歌

hymn.英释: a song of praise to God

robe.中释: 长袍, 罩衣, 礼服, 制服
robe.英释: a long loose piece of clothing, especially one worn for official ceremonies

tusk.中释: 长牙, 獠牙, 尖牙
tusk.英释: one of a pair of very long pointed teeth, that stick out of the mouth of animals such as  elephants

flux.中释: 涨潮, 变迁, [物]流量, 通量

moor.英释: a wild open area of high land, covered with rough grass or low bushes and  heather  , that is not farmed because the soil is not good enough

fold.中释: 折, 羊栏, 折痕, 信徒
fold.英释: a line made in paper or material when you fold one part of it over another

gust.中释: 阵风, 一阵狂风, (雨、冰雹、烟、火、声音等的)突然一阵，（感情的）迸发，汹涌
gust.英释: a sudden strong movement of wind, air, rain etc

levy.中释: 征收, 征税, 征兵
levy.英释: A levy is a sum of money that you have to pay, for example, as a tax to the government

text.中释: 正文, 原文, 课文, 课本
text.英释: the writing that forms the main part of a book, magazine etc, rather than the pictures or notes

prop.中释: 支持者, 倚靠人, 道具, 螺旋桨
prop.英释: a small object such as a book, weapon etc, used by actors in a play or film

loom.英释: a frame or machine on which thread is woven into cloth

nave.中释: 中央广场, 车轮的中心部
nave.英释: the long central part of a church

axis.英释: the imaginary line around which a large round object, such as the Earth, turns

lard.英释: white fat from pigs that is used in cooking

host.中释: 主人, 旅馆招待 许多
host.英释: someone at a party, meal etc who has invited the guests and who provides the food, drink etc

heed.英释: to pay attention to something, especially something someone says, and seriously consider it

pomp.中释: 壮丽, 盛况, 夸耀
pomp.英释: all the impressive clothes, decorations, music etc that are traditional for an important official or public ceremony

pose.英释: the position in which someone stands or sits, especially in a painting, photograph etc

sect.中释: 宗派, 教派, 教士会, 流派, 部分, 段
sect.英释: a group of people with their own particular set of beliefs and practices, especially within or separated from a larger religious group

lope.英释: to run easily with long steps

fret.中释: (使)烦恼, (使)焦急, (使)腐蚀, (使)磨损
fret.英释: to worry about something, especially when there is no need

wilt.英释: if a plant wilts, it bends over because it is too dry or old

tilt.中释: (使)倾斜, (使)翘起, 以言词或文字抨击
tilt.英释: to move a part of your body, especially your head or chin, upwards or to the side

trot.中释: (使)小跑, (使)快步走, 骑马小跑, 疾走
trot.英释: if a horse trots, it moves fairly quickly with each front leg moving at the same time as the opposite back leg

slay.中释: <书>杀, 杀死, 宰杀, 杀害, 宰杀, 杀死
slay.英释: to kill someone – used especially in newspapers

hush.英释: to make someone stop shouting, talking, crying etc

knit.中释: 编织, 密接, 结合
knit.英释: to make clothing out of wool, using two knitting needles

twit.英释: to tease, taunt, or reproach, often in jest

mock.中释: 嘲笑, 骗, 挫败, 嘲弄
mock.英释: to laugh at someone or something and try to make them look stupid by saying unkind things about them or by copying them

muse.英释: to say something in a way that shows you are thinking about it carefully

avow.英释: If you avow something, you admit it or declare it

glut.英释: to cause something to have too much of something

tout.英释: to praise something or someone in order to persuade people that they are important or worth a lot

waft.英释: if a smell, smoke, or a light wind wafts somewhere, or if something wafts it somewhere, it moves gently through the air

mash.英释: to crush something, especially a food that has been cooked, until it is soft and smooth

gaze.英释: to look at someone or something for a long time, giving it all your attention, often without realizing you are doing so

howl.中释: 嚎叫, 怒吼, 嚎啕大哭, 喝住, 号叫
howl.英释: if a dog,  wolf  , or other animal howls, it makes a long loud sound

slew.英释: to turn or slide in a different direction suddenly and violently, or to make a vehicle do this

meld.英释: if two things meld, or if you meld them, they combine into one thing

slog.英释: to make a long hard journey somewhere, especially on foot

snip.英释: to cut something by making quick cuts with scissors

swap.英释: to give something to someone and get something in return

soak.英释: if you soak something, or if you let it soak, you keep it covered with a liquid for a period of time, especially in order to make it softer or easier to clean

hack.英释: to cut something roughly or violently

espy.英释: to suddenly see someone or something

loll.英释: to sit or lie in a very lazy and relaxed way

abut.英释: if one piece of land or a building abuts another, it is next to it or touches one side of it

loot.中释: 掠夺, 抢劫, 劫掠
loot.英释: to steal things, especially from shops or homes that have been damaged in a war or  riot

rove.中释: 漫游, 流浪, 转来转去, 纺成粗纱
rove.英释: to travel from one place to another

mope.英释: to feel sorry for yourself, without making any effort to do anything or be more happy

rave.英释: to talk in an angry, uncontrolled, or crazy way

deem.英释: to think of something in a particular way or as having a particular quality

seep.英释: to flow slowly through small holes or spaces

etch.英释: to cut lines on a metal plate, piece of glass, stone etc to form a picture or words

rend.英释: to tear or break something violently into pieces

hiss.中释: 嘶嘶作声, 用嘘声表示
hiss.英释: To hiss means to make a sound like a long "s."

cram.英释: if a lot of people cram into a place or vehicle, they go into it so it is then full

daub.英释: to put paint or a soft substance on something without being very careful

blur.中释: 涂污, 污损(名誉等), 把(界线,视线等)弄得模糊不清, 弄污
blur.英释: to become difficult to see, or to make something difficult to see, because the edges are not clear

sift.英释: to examine information, documents etc carefully in order to find something out or decide what is important and what is not

blab.英释: If someone blabs about something secret, they tell people about it

sham.英释: to pretend to be upset, ill etc to gain sympathy or an advantage

jolt.英释: to move suddenly and roughly, or to make someone or something move in this way

gnaw.中释: 咬, 啃, 啮, 使苦恼, 消耗, 折磨, 侵蚀

lure.英释: to persuade someone to do something, especially something wrong or dangerous, by making it seem attractive or exciting

gush.英释: if words or emotions gush out, you suddenly express them very strongly

bode.英释: If something bodes ill, it makes you think that something bad will happen in the future. If something bodes well, it makes you think that something good will happen.

rent.英释: to regularly pay money to live in a house or room that belongs to someone else, or to use something that belongs to someone else

wade.英释: to walk through water that is not deep

wane.中释: 变小, 亏缺, 衰落, 退潮, 消逝, 呈下弦
wane.英释: if something such as power, influence, or a feeling wanes, it becomes gradually less strong or less important

dote.英释: If you say that someone dotes on a person or a thing, you mean that they love or care about them very much and ignore any faults they may have

trek.英释: to make a long and difficult journey, especially on foot

tend.英释: to move or develop in a particular direction

bask.中释: 晒太阳(享受温暖), 感到温暖, 愉快或舒适
bask.英释: to enjoy sitting or lying in the heat of the sun or a fire

jink.中释: 闪身, 急转, 逃走

shun.英释: to deliberately avoid someone or something

pare.中释: 剥, 削, 修, 削减, 消灭
pare.英释: If you pare something down or back, or if you pare it, you reduce it

flay.中释: 剥皮, 去皮, 抢夺, 严厉批评

faze.中释: 打扰, 折磨, 使狼狈, 使担忧

aver.英释: to say something firmly and strongly because you are sure that it is true

emit.中释: 发出, 放射, 吐露, 散发, 发表, 发行
emit.英释: to send out gas, heat, light, sound etc

cloy.英释: if something sweet or pleasant cloys, it begins to annoy you because there is too much of it

weld.英释: to join metals by melting their edges and pressing them together when they are hot

bate.中释: 减弱, 减少, 抑制

abet.中释: 教唆, 煽动, 帮助, 支持
abet.英释: to help someone do something wrong or illegal

shed.中释: 流出, 发散, 散发, 脱落, 脱皮, 摆脱
shed.英释: to get rid of something that you no longer need or want

whet.中释: 磨, 磨快, 使兴奋
whet.英释: to make the edge of a blade sharp

ruck.英释: to become or make wrinkled, creased, or puckered

slit.英释: to make a straight narrow cut in cloth, paper, skin etc

maim.中释: 使残废, 使不能工作
maim.英释: to wound or injure someone very seriously and often permanently

wean.中释: 使断奶, 使丢弃, 使断念
wean.英释: to gradually stop feeding a baby or young animal on its mother’s milk and start giving it ordinary food

sate.中释: 使心满意足, 过分的给与
sate.英释: to satisfy (a desire or appetite) fully

stun.中释: 使晕倒, 使惊吓, 打晕
stun.英释: If you are stunned by something, you are extremely shocked or surprised by it and are therefore unable to speak or do anything

rive.中释: 撕开, 劈开, 使沮丧

gulp.中释: 吞, 一口吞(下), 忍住, 抑制
gulp.英释: to swallow large quantities of food or drink quickly

doff.英释: to remove the hat you are wearing as a sign of respect

flex.中释: 弯曲(四肢), 伸缩, 折曲vi折曲, 弯曲
flex.英释: If you flex your muscles or parts of your body, you bend, move, or stretch them for a short time in order to exercise them
